title: Your brain might be a quantum computer that hallucinates math
content:
Quick: what’s 4 + 5? Nine right? Slightly less quick: what’s five plus four? Still nine, right? Okay, let’s wait a few seconds. Bear with me. Feel free to have a quick stretch. Now, without looking, what was the answer to the first question? It’s still nine, isn’t it? You’ve just performed a series of advanced brain functions. You did math based on prompts designed to appeal to entirely different parts of your brain and you displayed the ability to recall previous information when queried later. Great job! This might seem like old hat to most of us, but it’s…

This story continues at The Next Web
description: You're not bad at math. Like pearls before swine, your beautiful brain is just far too complex for such basic things.
